com.github.lucadruda.iotc.device

Interface IIoTCClient

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    IoTCClient

    • Method Detail

      • SetProtocol

        void SetProtocol(IOTC_PROTOCOL transport)
        Set connection protocol (MQTT, AMQP, HTTPS). Must be called before Connect().
        Parameters:
        transport - Trasport to set. Default: MQTT

      • SetGlobalEndpoint

        void SetGlobalEndpoint(String endpoint)
        Set DPS global endpoint. Must be called before Connect()
        Parameters:
        endpoint - Endpoint of DPS server. Default: "global.azure-devices-provisioning.net"

      • SetProxy

        void SetProxy(HTTP_PROXY_OPTIONS options)
        Set network proxy Must be called before Connect(). Default: no proxy
        Parameters:
        options - Proxy options

      • SetLogging

        void SetLogging(IOTC_LOGGING logLevel)
        Set logging level (FULL, API_ONLY, DISABLED). Can be changed at any time.
        Parameters:
        logLevel - The logging level. Default: DISABLED

      • Disconnect

        void Disconnect(IoTCCallback callback)
         throws IoTCentralException
        Disconnect device.
        Parameters:
        callback - Callback executing when device successfully disconnect.
        Throws:
        IoTCentralException - if disconnection fails

      • Connect

        void Connect()
      throws IoTCentralException
        Connect device.
        Throws:
        IoTCentralException - if connection fails

      • SendTelemetry

        void SendTelemetry(Object payload,
                   IoTCCallback callback)
            throws IoTCentralException
        Send a telemetry message.
        Parameters:
        payload - The telemetry object. Can include multiple values in a flatten object. It can be a map, a POJO or a JSON string
        callback - The callback to execute when message is delivered to the hub
        Throws:
        IoTCentralException - if connection is dropped

      • SendState

        void SendState(Object payload,
               IoTCCallback callback)
        throws IoTCentralException
        Send a state message
        Parameters:
        payload - The state object. Can include multiple values in a flatten object. It can be a map, a POJO or a JSON string
        callback - The callback to execute when message is delivered to the hub
        Throws:
        IoTCentralException - if connection is dropped

      • SendEvent

        void SendEvent(Object payload,
               IoTCCallback callback)
        throws IoTCentralException
        Send events
        Parameters:
        payload - The event object. Can include multiple events in a flatten object. It can be a map, a POJO or a JSON string
        callback - The callback to execute when message is delivered to the hub
        Throws:
        IoTCentralException - if connection is dropped

      • SendProperty

        void SendProperty(Object payload,
                  IoTCCallback callback)
           throws IoTCentralException
        Send update values to properties.
        Parameters:
        payload - The property object. Can include multiple values in a flatten object. It can be a map, a POJO or a JSON string. If property is sent in the form {propertyName:{value:"value"}} and propertyName is the name of a command, then it sends updates to specific command tile in IoTCentral( e.g. command progress)
        callback - The callback to execute when message is delivered to the hub
        Throws:
        IoTCentralException - if connection is dropped

      • on

        void on(IOTC_EVENTS event,
        IoTCCallback callback)
        Listen to events.
        Parameters:
        event - The event to listen to.
        callback - The callback to execute when the event is triggered
